channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: As the rest of the country shifts back to the old childcare funding model, Victorian centres will get extra help to survive another severe lockdown.
item.title: Victorian childcare centres to get fee help after lockdown decision

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: A Dreamtime clash between Essendon and Richmond in Darwin is a live option for the AFL’s next fixture block as the league deals with yet another scheduling headache following the announcement that metropolitan Melbourne will return to lockdown.
item.title: Dreamtime game in the NT? Essendon-Richmond clash in Darwin on the cards

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Doctors are calling on governments to resist alcohol industry pressure and adopt pregnancy warning labels they previously sent back for revision.
item.title: 'Proven ineffective': Doctors urge stronger alcohol pregnancy warning labels

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: The NSW-Victoria border will close at 12.01 tomorrow. A travel ban is already in place for residents of Melbourne.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria stage 3 COVID-19 restrictions reimposed on Melbourne, Mitchell Shire Council as state records 191 new cases

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Police are searching bushland in Perth's north in relation to the disappearance of a North Beach teenager more than two decades ago.
item.title: Police search bushland near Yanchep for clues in Radina Djukich cold case

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Police will use number-plate recognition software to identify where drivers are travelling from, as authorities prepare to enforce Victoria's second wave of lockdowns from 11.59pm on Wednesday.
item.title: Police to scan number plates, defence roadblocks as Melbourne locks down

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Supermarkets say they have 'plenty of stock' and have called for calm after Premier Daniel Andrews announced a return to harsh lockdown restrictions.
item.title: 'No need to panic buy': Shops brace for second wave of shelf stripping

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Xavier Cooks becomes the sixth player contracted to the Kings next season, alongside Brad Newley, Craig Moller, Shaun Bruce, Jordan Hunter and Didi Louzada.
item.title: 'Huge for us': Kings avoid rebuild with re-signing of young gun Cooks

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Geelong champion Gary Ablett will be able to return to Victoria if he needs to be near his family after he revealed on Sunday that his son Levi had been diagnosed with a rare and degenerative disease.
item.title: Gary Ablett can opt out of hub at any time with Cats' full support

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: The owners of 81 Aquanita starters have been asked by Racing Victoria to show cause as to why their horses shouldn’t be disqualified from wins in which it was found those horses were doped before races.
item.title: Eighty-one Aquanita horses face disqualification

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The world's largest social media companies have found themselves in the middle of a tit-for-tat escalation over the future of China.
item.title: TikTok, Facebook, WhatsApp wedged between superpowers

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The new and necessary lockdowns in Victoria are a stark reminder that coming to terms with this pandemic will take patience, co-operation and good leadership.
item.title: A terrible day for Victoria but decisive action had to be taken

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Senior Al-Taqwa College students are said to be main source of Victoria's second-largest COVID-19 cluster, which has exploded from a few cases last week to 90.
item.title: Senior students behind runaway COVID-19 cluster at Al-Taqwa College

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Labor is calling for Australia to introduce its own Magnitsky Act to target human rights abusers after the United Kingdom unveiled its much-anticipated laws.
item.title: Labor calls for an Australian Magnitsky Act to target human rights abusers

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Victoria has recorded 191 new cases of coronavirus, including 37 linked to outbreaks and 154 under investigation.
item.title: Victoria records 191 new cases of coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The Manly star has been indefinitely suspended by the NRL ever since he was hit with charges relating to the stabbing of a man at a church dance last year.
item.title: Fainu's fight to clear name on course for District Court

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Unheralded David Nofoaluma has been in such impressive form for the Wests Tigers, his name has appeared on the radar of NSW Origin officials.
item.title: Nofoaluma or Ferguson? Which right winger gets nod if Blues picked tomorrow

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Melbourne and several towns north of the city have been ordered back into lockdown for six weeks from midnight on Wednesday as COVID-19 cases continue to soar.
item.title: Melbourne, some regional areas to re-enter lockdown after 191 new coronavirus cases

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Rookie ruckman Joel Amartey was in line for a debut this weekend - then he hurt his groin, joining a remarkably long list of injured big men at Sydney.
item.title: Injury-hit Swans at a loss as AFL confirm no mid-year draft or loans

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Harley Bennell’s exile from football this time might be about the briefest of his career with the skilful player in the frame to make a return to the Melbourne team.
item.title: Bennell and Jones in frame for Demons

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Deloitte has cast doubt on whether its sale of the airline to Bain is as watertight as originally presented, with court documents revealing the deal is conditional and could still be terminated.
item.title: Court documents challenge 'watertight' Virgin sale to Bain

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Labor MPs Bill Shorten and Peter Khalil are concerned for the welfare of 3000 people locked down in Melbourne public housing towers.
item.title: Federal Labor MPs question state government's public housing lockdown

item.description: This week on the Real Footy podcast, Michael Gleeson, Caroline Wilson and Greg Baum discuss the issues that the Pies are dealing with.
item.title: Real Footy podcast: 'You wonder if there's a discipline problem at Collingwood'

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australians living in and travelling to China have been warned they may be arbitrarily detained.
item.title: Australia upgrades travel warning for China

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Evidence about cars parked outside the home where William Tyrrell vanished and the recollections of a Kendall man who claimed to have seen him in a car being driven away was doubted by investigators.
item.title: Trove of Tyrrell documents show police doubted evidence of key witnesses

item.description: Three-year-old gelding El Cohete struggled over six trials and slipped under the radar on debut, but trainer Joe Pride believes Warwick Farm may host his breakthrough.
item.title: It's been a long long time but Rocket man's fuse finally lit

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Warwick Farm on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Long queues are expected to form on both sides of the border of Victoria and NSW after its closure,as authorities scramble to enact a permit system allowing residents to travel between border towns on either side.
item.title: Authorities prepare for long queues ahead of Vic-NSW border closure

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Racing chiefs confident that the sport can ride out latest COVID-19 escalation and that spring carnival will go ahead as planned.
item.title: RV chiefs confident racing and carnival won't be stopped by lockdowns

item.description: Police allege that Corey Hurren brought a prohibited M14 rifle, plus the shotguns and a revolver made by Hi-Standard to the grounds of the PM's residence.
item.title: Armed gatecrasher threatened Justin Trudeau: police

item.description: West Australian bikie Troy Mercanti has been arrested again after returning to WA from over east having allegedly attended a gang funeral, potentially breaching his post sentence supervision order.
item.title: WA bikie arrested after trip east for gang funeral

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Can Mason Cox stand up or is the experiment over?
item.title: Can Pies afford to give up on the American dream?

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: RBA governor Philip Lowe cautions of a "bumpy" recovery while holding official interest rates steady for another month.
item.title: Victoria shutdown a threat to the economy as RBA holds record low rates

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Hospital's deadly demolition, national mine dispute: warning, and a beast for all seasons
item.title: In the Herald: July 14, 1997

item.description: The Islamic Women’s Council of NZ says it warned authorities repeatedly about threats to mosques from white supremacists including one on March 15, 2019.
item.title: 'Asleep on the job': Police warned of another mosque threat before massacre

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: In this week's special episode of The Televisionaries podcast, TV experts from The Age and The Sydney Morning Herald discuss their top shows of the year so far.
item.title: This strange sci-fi series is one of the best shows of the year

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: The men’s tennis tour has tinkered with the system to determine world rankings during the COVID-19 crisis, which could have an impact on whether players choose to play both the US Open and French Open.
item.title: ATP tinkers with rankings system during COVID crisis

item.description: The hard lockdown of the Flemington and North Melbourne towers shows we can all do better at communicating with public housing residents.
item.title: Social housing helped me rise, it mustn't be left to decline

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: The lawyer for the assistant nurse said his client deserved to be "congratulated" for her quick-thinking actions that prevented something worse occurring.
item.title: Aged care nurse cleared of assault after tying elderly woman to chair

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The opposition proposes to introduce mandatory jail time for third convictions and reinvest youth justice funds in troubled communities.
item.title: LNP's youth crime plan criticised as 'backward thinking'

item.description: The director of Buxton Contemporary has nominated 'Tjala Tjukurpa/Honey Ant Story' by Yaritji Young as one of his favourite local works.
item.title: Indigenous culture revealed in art, says Buxton's Ryan Johnston

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: In this episode, national editor Tory Maguire is joined by South-East Asia correspondent James Massola to discuss the challenges Indonesia faces in trying to contain the virus.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: Indonesia, the coronavirus hot-spot next door

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: Only a month ago, Melbourne was ready to confidently ease more coronavirus restrictions. On Tuesday, the state recorded 191 new coronavirus cases. This map shows where the case numbers are multiplying now.
item.title: How coronavirus cases are surging in the suburbs

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Friends and family have described Paramount Nightclub manager Giuseppe 'Peppe' Raco as a family man and "beautiful person" who left his native Calabria to come and work in Australia.
item.title: 'A beautiful person taken too young': Tributes flow for Paramount manager as police boost Northbridge patrols

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Western United CEO Chris Pehlivanis has praised the FFA for its attempt to get Victoria's three A-League teams across the border to NSW, despite the fact the last-minute flight to Canberra couldn't take off on Monday night.
item.title: 'We are not angry': Praise for FFA despite flight hiccup

item.dc:creator: Alice Clarke
item.description: Wireless sound systems are great, but depending on where you live you might need to be prepared for a wired plan B.
item.title: When it comes to home theatre systems, sometimes wired is wiser

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Sam Taylor is set to miss at least the next month of football after being left bed-ridden by the joint infection.
item.title: Giants defender in hospital with infection after back injury 'spiralled out of control'

item.description: With the filmed version of the hit musical streaming, the critical questions about Alexander Hamilton and the show's depiction of him are back.
item.title: FAQ about Hamilton and the historical record

item.description: If you fear lockdown has caused many children to become less socially skilled and less empathetic, you're not alone.
item.title: How to home-school your children in social skills
